title: Maharashtra Labour Department issues notice to TCS over ‘forced’ transfers
description: NITES claims that it has received more than 300 complaints where TCS has been systematically forcing more than 2,000 employees to transfer to different cities without proper notice or consultation.
content: The Maharashtra labour department has issued a notice to Tata Consultancy Services over a complaint related to alleged forced transfers of employees.The labour department has asked TCS to explain its stand on the matter during a formal meeting on January 18.The Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), an organisation that works with IT/ITeS and related-sector employees, had filed a complaint with the state’s Ministry of Labour and Employment, accusing TCS of transferring more than 2,000 employees without proper notice or consultation, ET reported on November 15.TCS did not provide an immediate comment on the issue.According to company insiders that ET has spoken with, transfers were a “routine” activity.
